intro: Lomaria deltoides, commonly known as the deltoid lomaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Lomaria deltoides is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, where it is adapted to dry conditions.
